name: 朴維鎮
objective: This course is about using data to make decisions. Recent years have seen an explosion of the amount of data available to everyone, and making sense of that data has become an operational imperative. The tools of statistics are one of the ways we can make sense of the data and use it to make more effective decisions. The aim of this course is to learn how to make decisions and solve problems through efficient decision-making skills and data mining techniques based on data. Specifically in this course we will discuss basic probability theory and its use as a basis for inferential statistics, discuss efficient decision-making techniques, and develop ability in the use of MINITAB for decision-making analysis.
schedule:
Week 1 Introduction to data analysis for decision-making
Week 2 Random variables, mean, median, standard deviation, and variance
Week 3 Correlation and covariance: MINITAB practice and interpretation
Week 4 Hypothesis tests – Part I
Week 5 Hypothesis tests – Part II: MINITAB practice and interpretation
Week 6 Simple linear regression – Part I
Week 7 Simple linear regression – Part II: MINITAB practice and interpretation
Week 8 Interim report – Presentation of individual (or team) project
Week 9 Interim report – Presentation of individual (or team) project
Week 10 Multiple linear regression – Part I
Week 11 Multiple linear regression – Part II: MINITAB practice and interpretation
Week 12 Classification – Part I: Logistic regression, MINITAB practice and interpretation
Week 13 Classification – Part II: k-NN, MINITAB practice and interpretation 
Week 14 Classification – Part III: SVM, MINITAB practice and interpretation
Week 15 Clustering – Part I: Hierarchical clustering, MINITAB practice and interpretation
Week 16 Clustering – Part II: Nonhierarchical clustering, MINITAB practice and interpretation
Week 17 Final presentation of individual (or team) project
Week 18 Final presentation of individual (or team) project
materials:
Data analysis and decision making , 4th Ed. by Albright, Winston, and Zappe
Engineering Statistics (5th Ed., Wiley) by Montgomery, Runger, and Hubele (ISBN: 978-0-324-59433-1)
